How to Install hello-traditional on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • hello-traditional

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install hello-traditional on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing hello-traditional on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall hello-traditional in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install hello-traditional, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install hello-traditional Using apt

To install hello-traditional in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install hello-traditional using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install hello-traditional

The installation of hello-traditional might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install hello-traditional Using apt-get

To install hello-traditional using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install hello-traditional.

sudo apt-get -y install hello-traditional

Install hello-traditional Using Synaptic

To install hello-traditional using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install hello-traditional on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for hello-traditional. This will display the hello-traditional package in the package window, now to install hello-traditional, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the hello-traditional package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of hello-traditional.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install hello-traditional Using aptitude

To install hello-traditional on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of hello-traditional.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install hello-traditional using the command aptitude install hello-traditional.

sudo aptitude -y install hello-traditional

How to Upgrade hello-traditional on debian

If you want to upgrade the hello-traditional package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade hello-traditional using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade hello-traditional to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade hello-traditional.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade hello-traditional sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade hello-traditional

Upgrade hello-traditional using Aptitude

To upgrade hello-traditional using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade hello-traditional.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade hello-traditional

Upgrade hello-traditional using Synaptic

To upgrade hello-traditional using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for hello-traditional, now right-click hello-traditional, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade hello-traditional just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall hello-traditional on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall hello-traditional from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just hello-traditional, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove hello-traditional

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of hello-traditional

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of hello-traditional you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge hello-traditional

Remove hello-traditional using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall hello-traditional using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for hello-traditional, right-click the hello-traditional package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall hello-traditional click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install hello-traditional on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade hello-traditional using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of hello-traditional then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
